Articles.Content:
Screenshots from the game can make impressive visuals.

The F2 key was designated to clear the screen of all info and present an appealing picture. There are many offenders to this sin of mucking up the shot, KSP stock messes it up by presenting info such that the batteries are depleted, while many mods remain visible or present info dead centre of the shot.

With KSP getting to that polished finished state the priority of retaining the pristine F2 screenshot is being glossed over.
I'm almost 100% sure that stock KSP doesn't give messages about empty batteries, TAC Life Support does however.

I think he means the on screen messages like this.

Not Enough Electric Charge

F2 only hides the flight GUI. I would like it to hide text and also the green highlight when mousing over parts.

"No Target" and "Time Warp x1" included!

I personally play with Anti-Alias on x2 due to hardware limitations. But I find myself pretty often pausing the game, going to settings and turning the AA all the way up for a nice Screenshot. Then, I need to wait for those two messages to diasppear before pressing F1.
There are many messages like that in stock too, like um... You know I ignore them so much that I forget what they say... Something about camera being set to "Auto."
Doesn't bother me. I don't seem to have this problem

As a (casual) youtuber I agree.

- would be very nice to disable part highlighting in flight, it is sometimes useful but if it was an option I'd probably leave it always switched off, unless I was trying to make a very specific point about part of a craft. I don't find I have any use for it when playing normally.

- the text is not so bad, but would still be nice to be able to hide it sometimes.

- and disable the camera text too. and while we're on camera modes; default mode really needs to be an option. I try to remember to hit V first thing after launching or switching to a craft. When just playing I find it distracting being suddenly flipped 90 degs, but when making vids.....argh! Its the No. 1 reason for needing to film a second take!

I think this is a good suggestion (should prob be in the suggestions section)

[Comms-DTS-M1]:Uploading Data...10%

EDIT: As in, don't take a screeny while uploading data.
